sentences: Lia Purpura (born February 22, 1964, Mineola, New York) is an American poet, writer and educator.

A graduate of Oberlin College and the Iowa Writers' Workshop where she was a Teaching/Writing Fellow in Poetry, Lia Purpura is currently Writer-in-Residence at University of Maryland, Baltimore County in Baltimore, Maryland.
She lives in Baltimore with her husband, conductor Jed Gaylin, and their son.
In 2012, Lia Purpura was awarded a Guggenheim Fellowship.

Lia Purpura is also the recipient of a National Endowment for the Arts Fellowship, a Fulbright Award Fellowship (translation, Warsaw, Poland), multiple residences at the MacDowell Colony, and a grant from the Maryland State Arts Council.
The Poulenc Trio:  Creation, featuring Lia Purpura, poet, (Delos/Naxos, 2016)
